channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Boulanger brade à -30 % ce laptop Acer sous Snapdragon X à l’autonomie généreuse
item.description: Chez Boulanger, l'Acer Aspire 14 IA perd 200 euros de son prix grâce au combo entre une promotion et une reprise de votre ancienne machine. Vous pourrez donc l'acheter pour 499,99 euros.

item.title: 14 Best Travel Toiletry Bags, Tested Over Many Miles (2026)
item.description: Our team evaluated a ton of toiletry bags to find the best storage, organization, and design options for all your essentials.

item.title: How to watch Liverpool vs West Ham: Free Streams, TV Channels, Preview
item.description: We'll show you how to watch Liverpool vs West Ham live streams from anywhere in the world as the Reds seek to close the gap to the Premier League top four.

item.title: The Best Gadgets of February 2026
item.description: Sure, Valve delayed the Steam Machine, but Samsung, Nintendo, Sony, and more had surprises in store.

item.title: The Best MicroSD Cards for Your Camera, Switch, and More
item.description: Everything you need to know about memory cards for cameras, video game systems, and more.

item.title: Steam Next Fest, a different flavor of The Witcher and other new indie games worth checking out
item.description: Welcome to our latest roundup of what's going on in the indie game space. It's Steam Next Fest week, with literally thousands of demos for upcoming games for us to dive into. I'm trying to check out as many as I can before the event wraps up on Monday. However, I made a near-critical error in my planning: I opted to try the Raccoin demo first. I could and would have happily played that all week.This is a coin-pushing roguelike deckbuilder that adopts the format of Balatro. To progress, you need to earn a certain number of points and the target increases each round. Every three rounds there's a...

item.title: The Best Laptop Cooling Pad and Why You Should Buy One
item.description: Most laptop cooling pads are useless, but if you get the right one, it can make a huge impact on how long your gaming laptop lasts.

item.title: Area Man Accidentally Hacks 6,700 Camera-Enabled Robot Vacuums
item.description: Plus: The top US cyber agency falls into shambles, AI models develop an upsetting penchant for nuclear weapons, and more.

item.title: Où vaut-il mieux chercher des microbes vivants sur Mars ? La Nasa a peut-être la réponse et ce n'est pas où on le pensait !
item.description: Dans une étude, publiée dans la revue Astrobiology, des chercheurs avancent que les futures missions de recherche de vie sur Mars ne devraient pas privilégier l'étude de roches, d'argiles ou de sols. Ce que l'on avait toujours fait jusqu'à présent.

item.title: EveryPlate’s Meal Kit Offers Affordable Vegetarian Options
item.description: HelloFresh’s budget subsidiary surprised me with its basic but tasty vegetarian meal selection.

item.title: Test du vidéoprojecteur ViewSonic LX60HDB : LED Full HD compact, malin pour le streaming, limité pour le jeu
item.description: Le ViewSonic LX60HDB est un projecteur LED Full HD avec Google TV intégré, pensé pour le streaming et la simplicité d’usage. Au programme : une image jusqu’à 140 pouces, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth et son intégré pour 250 euros environ. Voyons ce qu’il en est exactement.

item.title: The War on Poaching Has Gone Full Tech Dystopia—and It May Not Be Working
item.description: Surveillance technology intended to protect endangered species is weaponized against locals, with repercussions that range from harassment to physical violence.

item.title: Looking for a holiday bargain? Don't get caught out — experts warn of dark web travel agencies using stolen credit cards to buy hotels, flights, and more
item.description: Cybercriminal networks resell real travel bookings bought with stolen credit cards.

item.title: ICYMI: the 7 biggest tech stories of the week, from the Samsung Galaxy S26 series to Apple's 'big week'
item.description: Here's what's been happening across the world of technology over the last seven days.

item.title: We need a ‘Stop, Drop, and Roll’ PSA for the AI age
item.description: With visual truth shattered forever and zero self-regulation by the tech industry, it’s time to educate people, hard. “We are cooked.”

item.title: 3 affordable networking options that work better than LinkedIn
item.description: LinkedIn may seem like the easiest way to network, but solo business owners can create their own networking opportunities wherever and whenever they want. Networking as a solopreneur can feel impossible. LinkedIn is full of the sort of hustle-culture aficionados who think yoga at 4 a.m. is something to brag about and who want you to buy their online course. Joining a networking referral group often costs money and can require a big time commitment without a guarantee of new leads. Asking friends and family to make referrals for you gives you flashbacks to that one summer in college when you go...

item.title: What VCs sound like to normal people
item.description: Venture capitalists are asset managers, but talk like superheroes. Here’s why. Earlier this year, I had coffee with the chief investment officer of a large public pension fund. His fund doesn’t invest directly into venture (they have a fund of funds position instead), so my new CIO friend doesn’t usually get pitched directly by VC funds. He doesn’t spend a ton of time in tech circles either....

item.title: Zillow revises its home price forecast across over 400 housing markets—see the map
item.description: Zillow slightly downgrades its national home price outlook—predicting that over the next 12 months, U.S. home prices are likely to rise +0.9%. Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter.
